question.prompt: What is the primary or chief problem for which patient is seeking this second opinion?
Please describe patient's problem in detail as you understand it.
What is the principal (chief) question or concern you have regarding patient's current pregnancy?
What are the three most important questions you would like to ask the Cleveland Clinic consulting physician?
How many times has the patient been pregnant?
How many live born children has patient had?
What is the age of the patient?
What is patient's delivery due date?
Has patient's due date been changed? (choose one)
If yes, why was patient's due date changed?
Will the patient be less than 17 or greater than 34 years old at the time of delivery? (choose one)
If yes, at what age will the patient be at time of delivery?
At what point in patient's pregnancy did patient discover there was a problem?
Please describe below any signs and symptoms patient is having as a result of her condition. Provide as many details as possible:
When was the first day of patient's last menstrual period?
How many days on average from the first day of one menstrual period to the first day of patient's next? (for example, 28 days)
Does patient ever miss periods? (choose one)
If yes, how often?
Is this a single pregnancy? (choose one)
If no, and there is more than one fetus, how many?
Is this pregnancy the result of infertility treatment?
If yes, please describe the specific testing which was done, diagnosis (if applicable) and type of infertility treatment below:
How many times has patient been pregnant excluding this pregnancy?
Has patient had any full-term (37+ week gestational age) deliveries?
If yes, how many? (# of full-term deliveries)
Please provide additional information below regarding patient's full-term deliveries
Has patient had any pre-term deliveries?
If yes, how many? (# of pre-term deliveries)
Please complete table below regarding patient's pre-term deliveries:
Has patient had any miscarriages?
If yes, how many? (# of miscarriages)
Please include details of all miscarriages below:

column_definition.label: Result of miscarried tissue testing (if applicable)

question.prompt: Has patient had any stillbirths or neonatal deaths?
If yes, how many? (# of stillbirths/neonatal deaths)
If yes, Please describe in detail the circumstances of stillbirths/neonatal deaths below:
Has any of patient's newborns gone to a neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) or a special care nursery?
If yes, please describe circumstances in depth below:
Has patient had any abortions?
If yes, how many? (# of abortions)
If yes, were any for pregnancy complications due to fetal anomalies? (choose one)
If yes, please describe in detail below:

Has patient had any testing in previous pregnancies that was abnormal such as a first trimester screen, second trimester serum screen (Tri Screen or Quad Screen), a glucose tolerance test (testing for gestational diabetes), chorionic villous sampling (CVS), an amniocentesis (amnio), or any other blood tests?
If yes, please describe in detail below:

Has patient had any testing during this pregnancy that was abnormal such as a first trimester screen, second trimester serum screen (Tri Screen or Quad Screen), a glucose tolerance test (testing for gestational diabetes), chorionic villous sampling (CVS), an amniocentesis (amnio), or any other blood tests?
If yes, please describe in detail below:
Has patient been told she has gestational diabetes during this pregnancy? (choose one)
If yes, please provide finger stick glucose level below:
Does patient know the gender of her unborn child?
If yes, what gender?
How was sex determined? (choose all that apply)
If other, please explain:
Are the patient and the father of the baby blood relatives?
If yes, what is their relationship?
What is patient's current weight in pounds or kilograms? (indicate if pounds or kilograms)
What did patient weigh right before this pregnancy? (indicate if pounds or kilograms)

Please tell us about patient's FAMILY history in patient or patient's immediate family members (biological children from this relationship and/or previous one; patient's mother, father, brothers, sisters, grandparents; parentsâ€™ brothers and sisters and their children) (complete table below):

table_data.cell: Baby who died before or soon after birth

question.prompt: Has patient had or does patient currently have any of the following conditions? (choose all that apply)

table_data.cell: Blood clots (Deep Vein Thrombosis / Pulmonary Embolus
Excessive bleeding after surgery, dental work, cut or scratch
Asthma, Tuberculosis, or other lung disease

question.prompt: Has patient had or does patient currently have any of the following conditions? (choose all that apply)

table_data.cell: Preterm delivery, preterm labor, or PPROM (preterm premature rupture of membranes)
Baby with group B strep infection

question.prompt: Is patient suffering from high blood pressure during this pregnancy? (choose one)
If yes, what is the most current blood pressure reading?
What is patient's blood type?
Is patient RH negative?
If yes, has patient received Rhogam?
Has patient ever received a blood transfusion?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the blood transfusion below:
Would patient refuse a blood transfusion if a doctor judged it to be medically necessary?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of a blood transfusion refusal below:
Has patient ever been in a major accident or suffered serious trauma?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the accident or trauma experience below:
During this pregnancy, has patient been hit, punched, kicked, or experienced trauma to abdominal area?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of experience below:
Does patient experience breast problems?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of breast problems below:
Has patient ever undergone a gynecological surgical procedure such as a cervical conization, A LEEP procedure, laser treatment, or cryosurgery of the cervix? (choose one)
If yes, please complete table below:
Has patient ever experienced complications from anesthesia?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the anesthesia complication(s) below:
Has patient ever had an abnormal pap smear?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the abnormal pap smear below:
Has patient ever been told that she has an abnormal uterus?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the abnormality of the uterus below:
Has patient ever been told she has an abnormality of her cervix?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the abnormality of the cervix below:
Has patient ever been told she has an incompetent cervix?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the incompetent cervix below:
Did patient's mother take DES (Diethylstilbestrol) or any other hormones when she was pregnant with patient?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the hormone therapy below:
Does patient have a family history of medical problems which might adversely affect patient's health or pregnancy?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the patient's family history below:
Does patient have gastrointestinal diseases, such as Crohn's, Colitis, Irritable Bowel, or an ulcer?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the gastronintestinal problem(s) below:
Does patient have a history of cancer?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the cancer history below:
Does patient have or has patient had any other problems or issues not asked about which patient feels may be important to this pregnancy?
If yes, please describe (in detail) the circumstances of the other problem or problems below:
Was patient smoking cigarettes when she became pregnant?
If yes, how many cigarettes per day? (# of cigarettes per day)
Is patient currently smoking cigarettes?
If yes, how many cigarettes per day? (# of cigarettes per day)
Was patient drinking alcohol when she became pregnant?
If yes, how many drinks per day or week? (# of drinks per day)
Is patient currently drinking alcohol?
If yes, how many drinks per day or week? (# of drinks per day)
Was patient using recreational drugs when she became pregnant? (choose one)
If yes, please describe names of drugs, how often, etc. below:
Is patient currently using recreational drugs? (choose one)
If yes, please describe type of drugs, how often, etc. below:
Was patient taking prescription medications, over the counter medications, vitamins, or supplements when she became pregnant?
If yes, please provide additional information below:
Is patient currently taking prescription medications, over the counter medications, vitamins, or supplements?
If yes, please provide additional information below:
What is patient's date of birth?
What is patient's ethnic background or ancestry? (choose one)
If other, please indicate:
Is patient employed outside of the home?
If yes, what is patient's occupation?
Has the patient or the baby's father or anyone in either family had any of the following? (choose all that apply)

table_data.cell: Thalassemia (Italian, Greek, Mediterranean, or Asian background only)?
Neural Tube defect such as meningomyelocele, spina bifida, or anencephaly?
Sickle Cell disease or trait (African descent)?
Hemophilia or other inherited problems of blood coagulation?
Any other inherited, genetic, or chromosomal disorders?
A child with birth defects not listed above?
Recurrent pregnancy loss or a stillbirth?

question.prompt: Please tell us about any history in this baby's father or his family (his biologic children from this relationship and /or a previous one; his mother, father, brothers, sisters, grandparents; his parent's brothers and sisters and their children):

table_data.cell: Baby who died before or soon after birth

question.prompt: Does baby's father smoke cigarettes?
If yes, how many cigarettes per day? (# of cigarettes per day)
If yes, how many cigarettes per day when pregnancy occurred? (# of cigarettes per day)
Does baby's father drink alcohol?
If yes, how many drinks per day or week? (# of drinks per day/week)
If yes, how many drinks per day/week when pregnancy occurred? (# of drinks per day/week)
Does baby's father take recreational drugs?
If yes, please describe names of drugs, how often, etc. below:
If yes, please describe type of drugs, how often, etc. taken when pregnancy occurred?
What is baby's father's date of birth?
What is baby's father's ethnic background or ancestry?
If other, please indicate:
Does baby's father work outside of the home?
If yes, what is his occupation?
Please tell us who patient and her physician have consulted about patient's current pregnancy. Provide details below:
May the Cleveland Clinic specialist contact patient's physician(s) if needed?
If yes, please complete section below.
List below, the name(s), addresses), phone, fax number(s) of each physician currently treating the patient
Please tell us anything else you feel is important for us to know that could assist us in providing you with your second opinion.
